HOW TO APPLY
Send your resume, contact information, and position title to careers@sienna-systems.com.
REQ#1901:Informatica Adminstrator - Alexandria, VA

This person will be part of the team that supports a growing Data Warehousing and Business Intelligence environment using Informatica, Oracle 11g/10g RDBMS, and SQL Server 2005/2008. This individual will be responsible for the following:
• Administering the Informatica environment on UNIX
• Apply patches / upgrades / hotfixes for Informatica PowerCenter
• Monitor performance, troubleshoot, and tune ETL processes
• Will be responsible for 24x7 support
• Work with Informatica vendor on any issues that arise
• Support the Informatica developer team as needed

1. Ensure development teams are following appropriate standards
2. Promote and deploy Informatica code
3. Assist development team at design time ensuring code will run at scale
4. Serve as an Informatica Developer as needed to get work completed.
• Write and maintain BASH shell scripts for administering the Informatica environment
• Design and implement appropriate error handling procedures
• Develop project, documentation, and ETL standards in conjunction with data architects
• Work with other team members to ensure standards around monitoring and management of the Informatica environment within the context of existing enterprise monitoring solutions

Qualifications:
• Excellent oral and written English communication skills

Specifically needs to be able to communicate well on phone calls
• Must be able to thrive under pressure and have a strong sense of ownership and responsibility for the project
• Minimum of 7-10 years of experience in the administration, architecture, design, and development of ETL programs using Informatica’s data integration tools;

1. Informatica experience must include working with large mission critical data systems (multiple terabytes in size with millions of rows processing per day)
2. Must be able to demonstrate mastery of Informatica command line utilities
3. Must be able to demonstrate mastery of quickly debugging and resolving issues that can arise with Informatica programs.
4. Must know how to navigate through the Informatica metadata repository
5. Expert knowledge of Informatica version 8.5 and above. Informatica version 9.x and above preferred;
6. Working with Informatica PowerExchange products is a plus
• Minimum 2 full lifecycle project experience with small development groups, e.g., leading ground up development of Informatica standards in one or more previous projects.
• Demonstrated ability to navigate through organizational and technical uncertainty
• Mastery of Unix concepts and commands, including process management, scripting, directory structures, file permissions and editors
• Solid background in Oracle database 11g

1. Must be able to read and understand an Oracle Explain Plan
2. Must understand and know Oracle hints
3. Solid experience building SQL queries, including creating sub-queries, minus/union, and inline queries
4. Stored procedure development experience
• Fluency with business concepts related to relational and dimensional data models
• BA/BS in computer science or equivalent experience
• Experience with large scale database application like Exadata would be a plus

The Weather Channel is the world's leading cross-platform media company with a portfolio that includes The Weather Channel television network, TWC digital properties (weather.com, mobile and tablet applications) and Weather Services International (WSI). Headquartered in Cobb County since 1982, The Weather Channel brand has connected millions of consumers by providing the most accurate weather forecasts, 24 hours a day. Seen in more than 100 million U.S. households, The Weather Channel network is one of the most widely-distributed cable networks. The Weather Channel online properties reach 60 million unique Web consumers each month. This includes 32 million consumers monthly through weather.com on mobile Web and mobile apps. TWC has the No.1 app on all smartphones and is the second most used app on all smartphones. WSI provides business-to-business weather services to media, aviation, marine and energy sectors.

Job Description

The ETL Informatica Systems Engineer will support of our EDW/BI program. This individual will act as the Sr. ETL Engineer for the TWC EDW/BI project and will be responsible for developing ETL applications using Informatica. Successful candidates will have demonstrated proficiency using the Informatica Suite of tools including Standard Edition Power Center, Team Based Development, Parallel Processing, and more. The role will focus on developing Extract, Transformation and Loading (ETL) procedures for implementing data integration and data loading tasks in support of the EDW/BI project.

Qualifications

·BS in computer science, or its equivalent

·7 years of relevant experience with demonstrated proficiency and progressive responsibilities to include the following experiences:

·Informatica PowerCenter

·Linux

·Solid MS SQL Server database skills including the ability to write complex SQL and stored procedures

·Fact and Dimensional data, including slowly changing dimensions

·Demonstrated proficiency with SOAP/XML and REST/JSON API use, including the use of oAuth and oAuth2.

·Demonstrated ability to establish priorities, organize and plan work to satisfy established timeframes.

·Proven ability to handle multiple tasks and projects simultaneously.

·Demonstrated experience in performance tuning for Informatica ETL processing

·Excellent analytical skills, attention to detail and problem-solving skills.

·Demonstrated proficiency converting shell and Perl programming to Informatica Objects

·Strong interpersonal and leadership skills and demonstrated ability to work comfortably with all levels within an organization and across business function

·Demonstrated proficiency with any of the following will be considered a plus.

·Contract Management Systems (Operative.one),

·Ad Delivery Systems (Google Double Click for Publishers Premium),

·Omniture,

·Nielson Ratings data,

·Peoplesoft Financials,

·Salesforce

·Yieldex

·Java and Perl programming

Additional Information

description:
Journey with us! Combine your career goals and sense of adventure by joining our exciting team of employees. Royal Caribbean Group is pleased to offer a competitive compensation and benefits package, and excellent career development opportunities, each offering unique ways to explore the world.

The Royal Caribbean Group’s Data Analytics and AI Team has an exciting career opportunity for a full time Senior Engineer, Informatica MDM reporting to the Director of Enterprise MDM & Quality.

This position will work on-site in Miramar, Florida.

Position Summary

We are seeking an experienced MDM Developer with a strong focus on Informatica SAS MDM and Party Model implementation. The ideal candidate will be responsible for configuring and customizing the MDM platform, ensuring data accuracy and consistency, integrating data from various sources, and optimizing performance. Proficiency in data quality management, data modeling, and effective communication with cross-functional teams is essential for this role.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities
• Informatica SAS MDM Configuration: Configure and customize Informatica SAS MDM to implement the Party Model, defining entity types, relationships, business rules, match and merge strategies, and user interfaces.
• Data Modelling: Work with data architects and stakeholders to design and maintain the data model for party-related entities within the Informatica SAS MDM platform, ensuring data accuracy and consistency.
• Data Integration: Integrate data from various source systems into Informatica’s SAS MDM platform through IDMC, performing data profiling, cleansing, and transformation to ensure data quality and integrity.
• Match and Merge: Implement match and merge rules to identify and consolidate duplicate records within the party entities, enabling a single and accurate view of each entity.
• Configure Address Doctor Engine-reference and email and phone verification.
• Data Quality Management: Define and implement data quality rules and workflows within the SAS MDM system to monitor, measure, and improve data quality across party related data.
• Experieince working with Refernce 360 and it’s usage within the MDM domain.
• Performance Optimization: Identify performance bottlenecks within the SAS MDM system and optimize data loading, matching, and retrieval processes for efficient and seamless data operations.
• Testing and Validation: Conduct unit testing and integration testing to validate MDM configurations, ensuring accuracy and completeness of data within the MDM repository.
• Documentation: Maintain comprehensive technical documentation, including design specifications, configuration guides, and troubleshooting manuals for the MDM implementation.
• Build UNIX shell scripting, Pre-Session, Post-Session UNIX Commands for automation of Informatica job scheduling, backup of repository etc.
• Work with SFTP/SSH file transfer and loading using SQL, PL/SQL, SQL *Loader.

Position Requirements
• Bachelor's Degree from an accredited college or university with a major in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, Business, or other related scientific or technical discipline.
• 4+ years of experience in MDM Development experience with a focus on Informatica MDM and Party Model implementation.
• Must have hands on experience implementing Informatica’s SAS MDM application.
• Experieince working with Refernce 360 and it’s usage within the MDM domain.
• Experience working with CAI, CDI and CDQ is a must.
• In-depth knowledge of Informatica’s SAS MDM tools, including IDMC, and their functionalities for party entities.
• Familiarity with data modelling principles and data integration techniques.
• Strong understanding of data quality management and data governance practices within an MDM environment.
• Proficiency in data profiling, data cleansing, and data transformation processes.
• Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills to troubleshoot MDM-related issues.
• Strong communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with cross functional teams and stakeholders.
• Knowledgeable in technology and software development processes.
• Good presentation development and delivery skills.
• Fair understanding of Agile methodologies (e.g., Scrum, Kanban) required.
• Experience with travel and hospitality industry is a huge plus.
• Knowledge of Data Warehouses/Lakehouse architectures, Master Data Management, Data Quality Management, Data Integration, and Data Warehouse architecture.

We know there's a lot to consider. As you go through the application process, our recruiters will be glad to provide guidance, and more relevant details to answer any additional questions. Thank you again for your interest in Royal Caribbean Group. We'll hope to see you onboard soon!

It is the policy of the Company to ensure equal employment and promotion opportunity to qualified candidates without discrimination or harassment on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, sexuality, gender identity or expression, marital status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Royal Caribbean Group and each of its subsidiaries prohibit and will not tolerate discrimination or harassment.

Senior Informatica Administrator

We are seeking an experienced and proficient Senior Informatica Administrator with over 7 years of expertise to join our dynamic IT team. As a key member responsible for managing our Informatica platform, you will play a crucial role in overseeing the installation, configuration, and optimization of Informatica environments. Your extensive experience in Informatica administration will be essential in ensuring the reliability, performance, and security of our data integration and ETL processes.

Responsibilities:
• Installation and Configuration: Lead the installation and configuration of Informatica PowerCenter and related components, ensuring optimal performance and scalability.
• Environment Management: Manage and maintain multiple Informatica environments, including development, testing, and production, to support the full software development lifecycle.
• Performance Tuning: Implement performance tuning strategies to optimize Informatica workflows, mappings, and sessions for efficient ETL processing.
• Security Management: Establish and enforce security policies and access controls within the Informatica environment, ensuring data integrity and compliance with organizational standards.
• Monitoring and Troubleshooting: Monitor system performance, troubleshoot issues, and implement corrective actions to minimize downtime and enhance system reliability.
• Backup and Recovery: Implement and manage backup and recovery strategies to safeguard Informatica metadata and configurations, ensuring data integrity in case of system failures.
• Patch and Upgrade Management: Plan and execute Informatica software upgrades and apply patches to stay current with the latest features, security updates, and bug fixes.
• Metadata Management: Oversee metadata management, ensuring consistency and accuracy of metadata across different environments.
• Collaboration: Collaborate with development teams, database administrators, and other stakeholders to support data integration requirements and resolve dependencies.
• Documentation: Maintain comprehensive documentation of Informatica configurations, processes, and procedures.

Requirements:
• Bachelor//'s or Master//'s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
• Over 7 years of proven experience as an Informatica Administrator in a large-scale enterprise environment.
• Expertise in installing, configuring, and administering Informatica PowerCenter, PowerExchange, and related tools.
• Strong understanding of ETL concepts, data integration, and data warehousing.
• Experience in performance tuning and optimizing Informatica workflows for large datasets.
• Knowledge of security best practices for Informatica environments, including user access management and encryption.
• Proficiency in monitoring tools for Informatica and experience in proactive issue identification and resolution.
• Experience with Informatica upgrades, patches, and applying hotfixes.
• Strong SQL and relational database skills.
• Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a team environment.

NerdsToGo es una marca genial y de rápido crecimiento que brinda soluciones informáticas a consumidores residenciales y pequeñas empresas. Brindamos servicio a todo tipo de tecnología, desde computadoras, teléfonos, tabletas e impresoras hasta redes, conexiones a Internet, seguridad y mucho más.

Resumen de trabajo

El Nerd debe tener una sólida experiencia en servicio de campo y habilidades de servicio al cliente. Los nerds deben tener habilidades técnicas sólidas, buenas habilidades de comunicación y el deseo de ser parte de un equipo emocionante y en crecimiento.
Responsabilidades
• Soluciones informáticas in situ para PC basadas en Windows y computadoras Apple
• Aislamiento y reparación de fallas de hardware y software de PC
• Protección antivirus y eliminación de spyware/adware
• Recuperación de datos y prevención de pérdidas
• Mejora de la seguridad informática
• Reparación y actualizaciones del sistema
• Apoyar la creación de soluciones para el hogar y las pequeñas empresas para resolver las necesidades de los clientes a corto y largo plazo.

job_title: Administrador de Redes y Tecnologías de la Información
description:
Administrador de Redes y Tecnologías de la Información

En nuestra organización, estamos buscando a un profesional destacado para liderar el área de redes, comunicaciones y ciberseguridad. Este profesional será responsable de garantizar la continuidad, disponibilidad, rendimiento y seguridad de la infraestructura de red y comunicaciones.

Será responsable tanto de la supervisión técnica como de la gestión del equipo y de la planificación estratégica en su ámbito. Además, deberá evaluar nuevas tecnologías, soluciones de infraestructura y proveedores, y planificar y liderar proyectos de evolución tecnológica.

Responsabilidades:
• Liderazgo Técnico y Estratégico:
• Definir y supervisar la estrategia de redes, comunicaciones y seguridad de la información.
• Evaluación de nuevas tecnologías y soluciones de infraestructura.
• Planificación y liderazgo de proyectos de evolución tecnológica.
• Gestión de Equipos:
• Coordinación y liderazgo del equipo técnico de redes y comunicaciones.
• Asignación de tareas y priorización.
• Vigilancia por la formación continua del personal.
• Supervisión de Operaciones:
• Garantía del correcto funcionamiento de la red y los sistemas de comunicaciones (LAN, WAN, WiFi, VPN, etc.).
• Supervisión de la gestión y resolución de incidencias complejas.
• Participación en el diseño e implementación de arquitecturas de red resilientes y seguras.
• Seguridad y Cumplimiento:
• Supervisión de las políticas de seguridad perimetral, cortafuegos, IDS/IPS, segmentación y monitorización.
• Aseguramiento del cumplimiento normativo en materia de ciberseguridad y privacidad.
• Liderazgo de respuestas a incidentes de seguridad de alto impacto.
• Relación con Terceros:
• Coordinación y negociación con proveedores de servicios y fabricantes.
• Representación del área de redes en comités técnicos, auditorías y revisiones.

Requisitos mínimos:
• Formación Académica:
• Ingeniería Técnica o Superior en Telecomunicaciones, Informática o similar.
• Experiencia Profesional:
• Mínimo 8 años de experiencia en administración de redes y sistemas.
• Al menos 3 años de liderazgo de equipos técnicos o proyectos de infraestructura.
• Experiencia probada en entornos complejos y críticos (entornos virtualizados, alta disponibilidad, servicios 24x7).
• Conocimientos Técnicos:
• Diseño, despliegue y administración de redes de datos.
• Seguridad perimetral: firewall, IDS/IPS, segmentación de red, autenticación 802.1x.
• Redes virtuales y tunelización: VPNs (IPSec, SSL, L2TP), tecnologías de cifrado.
• Entornos virtualizados: VMware, Virtuozzo, Hyper-V.
• Telefonía IP y redes convergentes (SIP, RTP, QoS).
• Herramientas de monitorización (Zabbix, PRTG, TheDude, etc.).
• Conocimientos de integración con sistemas Microsoft (Active Directory, GPOs) y Linux.
• Certificaciones técnicas relevantes (MikroTik, Cisco, Fortinet, Checkpoint, VMware).

Competencias:
• Liderazgo y gestión de equipos multidisciplinares.
• Altas capacidades de planificación y organización.
• Vision estratégica y orientación a resultados.
• Habilidad para comunicar con claridad, tanto en entornos técnicos como directivos.
• Capacidad de toma de decisiones bajo presión.
• Inglés fluido (mínimo B2).

Disponibilidad:
• Participación ocasional en guardias 24x7 para incidentes críticos o escalados de segundo nivel.
• Disponibilidad para viajar de forma puntual (revisión de sedes, auditorías, formación).

Valorable:
• Certificaciones en MikroTik, Cisco, Fortinet NSE4/Preofessional o superior.
• Certificación ITIL (gestión de servicios TI).
• CISA, CISM o equivalente (deseable para enfoque en seguridad).

Beneficios:
• Un entorno de trabajo dinámico y colaborativo.
• Posibilidad de trabajar en proyectos innovadores y desafiantes.
• Oportunidades de desarrollo profesional y formación continua.
• Trabajo híbrido y flexibilidad horaria.
• Contrato indefinido con periodo de prueba de 6 meses.
• Jornada completa.
• 23,5 días laborables de vacaciones anuales.
• Jornada de 2,5 meses intensiva en verano y en semana santa.
• Seguro médico privado.
• Seguro de vida.
• Franja salarial ajustada según adecuación al perfil.

Calificaciones del puesto:
• Licenciatura de una universidad acreditada en Ciencias de la Computación, Ingeniería o en un campo relacionado con la tecnología, O equivalente a través de una combinación de educación y / o experiencia tecnológica, O 12 años de experiencia en tecnología
• 7 años de experiencia identificando soluciones técnicas para problemas empresariales complejos, identificando los beneficios y riesgos de las soluciones y proporcionando recomendaciones
• 7 años de experiencia en tecnología, campo de ingeniería de datos en arquitectura, desarrollo de aplicaciones de datos escalables de extremo a extremo y canalizaciones de datos; Trabajar con el gerente de producto y los scrum masters y liderar el equipo para ayudar a la creación de historias y entregables de sprints.
• 7 años de experiencia liderando y desarrollando pipelines de datos automatizados de Informatica con al menos 4 años de Informatica Cloud (IICS) y conocimientos relevantes en creación de perfiles de datos, calidad de datos, herramientas de catálogo
• 7 años de experiencia trabajando en soluciones y plataformas de almacenamiento de datos empresariales, y conocimiento práctico de diferentes bases de datos (por ejemplo, RDBMS, Snowflake), S3 Datalake, CICD, Jenkins y tecnologías en la nube de AWS
• 5 años de experiencia diseñando, implementando soluciones de datos automatizadas utilizando Snowflake lakehouse; creación de flujos de trabajo, desarrollo y programación de procesos ETL mediante la programación de SQL o Python
• 5 años de experiencia asesorando a otro tecnólogo 5 años de experiencia implementando soluciones de datos adoptando, recomendando y mejorando CICD, gestión del cambio, seguridad de datos, procesos de auditoría
• 4 años de experiencia trabajando con las mejores prácticas de ingeniería de software en todo el ciclo de vida del desarrollo, incluidas metodologías ágiles, estándares de codificación, revisiones de código, administración de fuentes, procesos de compilación y pruebas.

If you’re passionate about innovation and love working in an environment where you can constantly improve and adopt new technologies to drive business results, then Nationwide’s Information Technology team could be the place for you! At Nationwide®, “on your side” goes beyond just words. Our customers are at the center of everything we do and we’re looking for associates who are passionate about delivering extraordinary care.

This role does not qualify for employer-sponsored work authorization. Nationwide does not participate in the Stem OPT Extension program.

This role will be filled in a hybrid capacity, with in-office collaboration in our Columbus, OH office 2 days per week.

Are you passionate about leveraging data to solve real business problems? Our team is looking for a collaborative, detail-oriented professional with strong experience in Oracle, SQL, and Teradata who can help us manage complex data needs and contribute to enterprise scale solutions.

As a Sr Engineer, Software Engineer you'll work hands-on with technologies like Informatica, Linux, and orchestration tools such as Universal Automation Center (UAC). A background in insurance, especially pricing and rating, is a bonus but not required.

Beyond technical expertise, we’re looking for someone who enjoys working closely with business partners, takes a methodical approach to problem solving, and is proactive in identifying potential roadblocks. You’ll be communicating across multiple teams including analysts, engineers, testers, and both offshore and onshore stakeholders, so strong communication and documentation skills are key.

If you’re someone who thrives in a collaborative environment and enjoys making data make sense, we’d love to connect.

#LI-KR1

Job Description Summary
If you’re enthusiastic about delivering secure technology solutions to support a company providing extraordinary care to its customers, then Nationwide Technology is the place for you. Nationwide's industry-leading technology workforce embraces an agile work environment and a collaborative culture to deliver outstanding solutions and results. If that sounds like something you aspire to, we want to hear from you!

As a Senior Software Engineer, you will focus primarily on providing high quality, efficient technology solutions to business partners by crafting new software applications or modifying and/or supporting existing packaged or custom-built applications. In this capacity, you’ll analyze, code, configure, test, debug, document and maintain applications.

Job Description

Key Responsibilities:
• Analyzes, solutions, develops, tests, debugs, documents and deploys software according to standards and best practices.
• Applies secure software and systems engineering practices throughout the delivery lifecycle to ensure our data and technology solutions are protected from threats and vulnerabilities.
• Uses DevSecOps practices, tooling and techniques.
• Drives continuous improvement and learning through ongoing training, practice and innovation.
• Manages project priorities, deadlines and deliverables proactively.

May perform other responsibilities as assigned.

Reporting Relationships: Reports to a Technology Manager/Director.

Typical Skills and Experiences:

Education: Undergraduate studies in computer science, management information systems, or other related degree. Technology experience or non-traditional technology certificates can be substituted for an undergraduate degree.

Experience: Two or more years of analysis and technology experience.

Knowledge, Abilities and Skills: Proficiency in one or more programming language such as Java, C++, Python, JavaScript. Knowledge of software development lifecycle. Proven ability to tackle moderately sophisticated business and development problems. Ability to thrive in a team environment. Insurance/financial services industry knowledge a plus.

Other criteria, including leadership skills, competencies and experiences may take precedence.

Staffing exceptions to the above must be approved by the hiring manager’s leader and Human Resources Business Partner.

Values: Regularly and consistently demonstrates Nationwide Values.

Job Conditions:

Overtime Eligibility: Not Eligible (Exempt)

Working Conditions: Office environment may vary based on team and/or location. Associates may have on-call responsibility after normal working hours and/or on weekends.

Benefits

We have an array of benefits to fit your needs, including: medical/dental/vision, life insurance, short and long term disability coverage, paid time off with newly hired associates receiving a minimum of 18 days paid time off each full calendar year pro-rated quarterly based on hire date, nine paid holidays, 8 hours of Lifetime paid time off, 8 hours of Unity Day paid time off, 401(k) with company match, company-paid pension plan, business casual attire, and more. Build Your Career at Informatica

We seek innovative thinkers who believe in the power of data to drive meaningful change. At Informatica, we welcome adventurous, work-from-anywhere minds eager to tackle the world's most complex challenges. Our employees are empowered to push their bold ideas forward, and we are united by a shared passion for using data to do the extraordinary for each other and the world.

Solution Architect - Remote

The solution architect role involves collaborating with internal teams, customers, and partners to create a comprehensive technical account plan/strategy and to lead sales engagements to their technical conclusion. As an important part of the sales team, you will drive success by understanding customer use cases and creating technical solutions using the Informatica Data Management Cloud. Your responsibilities extend to educating both customers and internal stakeholders about the Informatica value proposition, engaging in in-depth architectural discussions, and ensuring that solutions are optimized for successful deployment and usage in the cloud. Within the technical sales community, as a mentor to your team members, you will help develop collective selling assets, knowledge repositories, and enablement materials. To drive sustained revenue growth, you'll contribute to pipeline generation through the delivery of technical workshops, active participation in social media promotions, content creation for external distribution, and involvement in industry marketing events. Additionally, you will be a channel for feedback to the product management team and will support the Customer Success team through collaboration and supporting customer nurture activities to drive consumption.

You will report to the Manager, Technical Sales.

Our Ideal Candidate
• Basic knowledge of top 3 cloud ecosystems and top 2 data related technologies
• Basic knowledge of cloud computing security aspects
• Basic certification on at least 1 cloude cosystem and 1 data related cloud technology at the level defined by the business area of focus
• Skills on at least one INFA related software platform /technology
• Engage and create relationships with influencers, coaches, and decision makers, and partners
• Basic technical knowledge of hybrid deployment of software solutions, Data Warehousing, Database, and/or Business Intelligence software concepts and products.
• 2+ years of relevant experience in data integration, master data management, or data governance
• 2+ year of presales/technical sales, industry, or consulting experience
• BA/BS or equivalent educational background is required.

What You'll be Doing
• Manage customer engagements.
• Share best practices, content, and tips and tricks within the primary responsibilities
• Stay current on certification of services required for your responsibilities
• Perform all activities leading up to the delivery of a customer demo with some assistance including discovery, technical qualification/fit, customer presentations, standard demos, and related customer-facing communication
• Assist on RFP responses and/or POC's
• Partner with the CSM team on nurture activities including technical advisory, workshops, etc.
• Provide customer feedback on product gaps using Vivun
• Support demos at marketing events.

Perks & Benefits
• Comprehensive health, vision, and wellness benefits (Paid parental leave, adoption benefits, life insurance, disability insurance and 401k plan or international pension/retirement plans
• Flexible time-off policy and hybrid working practices
• Equity opportunities and an employee stock purchase program (ESPP)
• Comprehensive Mental Health and Employee Assistance Program (EAP) benefit

Our DATA values are our north star and we are passionate about building and delivering solutions that accelerate data innovations. At Informatica, our employees are our greatest competitive advantage. So, if your experience aligns but doesn't exactly match every qualification, apply anyway. You may be exactly who we need to fuel our future with innovative ideas and a thriving culture.

Informatica (NYSE: INFA), a leader in enterprise AI-powered cloud data management, brings data and AI to life by empowering businesses to realize the transformative power of their most critical assets. We pioneered the Informatica Intelligent Data Management Cloud™ that manages data across any multi-cloud, hybrid system, democratizing data to advance business strategies. Customers in approximately 100 countries and more than 80 of the Fortune 100 rely on Informatica. www.informatica.com. Connect with LinkedIn, X, and Facebook. Informatica. Where data and AI come to life.™

We are seeking a highly experienced Informatica Extract Transform Load (ETL) Developer to join our Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) team. This role is responsible for being a lead in designing, developing, and maintaining robust ETL processes using Informatica PowerCenter and Teradata. The ideal candidate will have expert understanding of data integration, performance tuning, and data warehousing best practices, with a focus on supporting healthcare-related data systems. The selected candidate will lead a small team of developers from a project delivery perspective while being responsible for their own development.

You’ll enjoy the flexibility to work remotely * from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.

Primary Responsibilities:
• Lead the design and implementation ETL solutions using Informatica PowerCenter to extract, transform, and load data from various agency sources
• Automate data staging processes and optimize ETL job scheduling for performance and efficiency
• Learn and grow in business understanding to support development of ETL solutions
• Administer and support ETL environments, including development and production systems
• Perform repository backups, recovery operations, and system maintenance
• Oversee and lead the development of mappings, mapplets, sessions, and workflows using a wide range of Informatica transformations
• Monitor and troubleshoot ETL jobs across development, testing, and production environments
• Write and optimize complex SQL queries and Unix Shell scripts for data marts and interfaces in Teradata
• Collaborate with stakeholders to define requirements, document technical solutions, and support project planning
• Participate in unit, integration, and system testing
• Provide technical support, mentoring, and guidance to team members
• Communicate project status and deliverables to leadership and clients
• Continuously learn and apply new technologies to enhance system performance and capabilities

You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.

Required Qualifications:
• 7+ years of experience with Informatica PowerCenter and ETL development
• 5+ years of experience writing complex SQL and performance tuning
• 5+ years of experience with Teradata (v17+), including Fastload, TPT, and Multiload utilities
• 3+ years of experience leading the design and implementation of ETL solutions using Informatica PowerCenter
• 3+ years of Informatica PowerCenter administration experience
• 3+ years of Unix Shell (Bash/Korn) scripting experience
• Proven solid communication, collaboration, and mentoring skills
• Proven solid organizational and time management skills

• 5+ years of data warehouse development experience
• 5+ years of data modeling experience using ERWIN or similar tools
• 2+ years of experience with Azure Data Factory and Snowflake
• Experience with scripting languages such as Python, R, or JavaScript (React)
• Experience with Medicaid, Medicare, or healthcare data systems
• Experience working in Agile environments
• Knowledge of BI and data integration technologies across relational and multidimensional systems
• Familiarity with Informatica Data Quality (IDQ), Address Doctor, and Metadata Manager
• Residing in or near Springfield, IL
• All employees working remotely will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy

Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to local labor markets, education, work experience, certifications, etc. In addition to your salary, we offer benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements).
